title: 150+ Heartfelt “Thinking of You” Quotes for Him

steps.title: Use a famous romantic quote to tell him you’re devoted to him.
steps.content: Use a famous romantic quote to tell him you’re devoted to him. Expressing your love is a great way to deepen your bond with your significant other. [1] X Research source But there are many ways to say “I love you.” Try out one of the quotes below to share everything that’s in your heart: “Thinking of You” Quotes for Boyfriends “We loved with a love that was more than love.” – Edgar Allan Poe “But you've slipped under my skin, invaded my blood and seized my heart.” – Maria V. Snyder “Love is friendship that has caught fire.” – Ann Landers “Love grows by giving. The love we give away is the only love we keep. The only way to retain love is to give it away.” – Elbert Hubbard “She knew she loved him when 'home' went from being a place to being a person.” – E. Leventhal “In all the world, there is no heart for me like yours. In all the world, there is no love for you like mine.” – Maya Angelou “I have crossed oceans of time to find you.” – Bram Stoker “Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.” – Zora Neale Hurston “Thinking of You” Quotes for Husbands “The minute I heard my first love story I started looking for you, not knowing how blind I was. Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.” – Rumi “True love stories never have endings.” – Richard Bach “I saw that you were perfect and I loved you. Then I saw that you were not perfect and I loved you even more.” – Angelita Lim “The real lover is the man who can thrill you by kissing your forehead or smiling into your eyes or just staring into space.” – Marilyn Monroe “Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.” – Antoine de Saint-Exupéry “A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.” – Mignon McLaughlin “I would rather spend one lifetime with you than face all the ages of this world alone.” – J.R.R. Tolkien “To be fully seen by somebody, then, and be loved anyhow—this is a human offering that can border on miraculous.” – Elizabeth Gilbert, Committed

steps.title: Remind him how adorable you are with a cute-as-can-be quote.
steps.content: Remind him how adorable you are with a cute-as-can-be quote. Sending a fun, light-hearted quote is a nice way to stay in touch during the day when you’re both busy at work. Here are some cute “thinking of you” quotes to send to help him get through the day: “I'm not telling you it's going to be easy, I'm telling you it's going to be worth it.” – Art Williams “I find the most beautiful moment’s of life aren’t just with you but because of you.” – Leo Christopher “To be your friend was all I ever wanted; to be your lover was all I ever dreamed.” – Valerie Lombardo “I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal.” – E.M. Forster “I like you very much. Just as you are.” – Helen Fielding “I love you more than coffee, but please don’t make me prove it.” – Elizabeth Evans “Spend a few minutes a day really listening to your spouse. No matter how stupid his problems sound to you.” – Megan Mullally “Whatever it is that makes you the person you are—that’s what I love. All of it.” – Amy Vincent “If I had a flower for every time I thought of you, I could walk through my garden forever.” – Alfred Tennyson “Love is like pi—natural, irrational, and very important.” – Lisa Hoffman “It’s always better when we’re together.” – Jack Johnson “Grow old with me. The best is yet to be.” – Robert Browning “I look at you and I would rather look at you than all the portraits in the world.” – Frank O’Hara “Why, darling, I don't live at all when I'm not with you.” – Ernest Hemingway “Every atom of your flesh is as dear to me as my own: in pain and sickness it would still be dear.” – Charlotte Brontë

steps.title: Send a hilarious quote to let him know you’re thinking about him.
steps.content: Send a hilarious quote to let him know you’re thinking about him. Laughter relaxes your whole body, protects your heart, and even burns calories! [2] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source Send him a laugh-out-loud quote to help him reap the many benefits of laughter… and have a great time doing it: “You can't blame gravity for falling in love.” – Albert Einstein “Love is like an hourglass, with the heart filling up as the brain empties.” – Jules Renard “Sometimes me think, ‘What is friend?’ and then me say, ‘Friend is someone to share the last cookie with.’” – Cookie Monster “I’m looking for what I call my move-the-body friends. I’m looking for the folks who are going to show up and wade through the deep with me.” – Brené Brown “I believe that if life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade, and try to find somebody whose life has given them vodka, and have a party.” – Ron White “To succeed in life, you need three things: a wishbone, a backbone, and a funny bone.” – Reba McEntire “Accept who you are. Unless you’re a serial killer.” – Ellen DeGeneres “I love you and it’s getting worse.” – Joseph E. Morris “When I was growing up, I always wanted to be someone. Now I realize I should have been more specific.” – Lily Tomlin “Before you criticize someone, you should walk a mile in their shoes. That way, when you criticize them, you are a mile away from them, and you have their shoes.” – Jack Handey “Rule no.1 is: Don’t sweat the small stuff. Rule no. 2 is: It’s all small stuff.” – Robert Eliot “How you can already miss someone when you are in the same room with them, I have no idea. But I do.” – Karen Harrington “I love you no matter what you do, but do you have to do so much of it?” – Jean Illsley Clarke “Come live in my heart and pay no rent.” – Samuel Lover “Love is being stupid together.” – Paul Valéry

steps.title: Show your support for him with a sympathetic quote.
steps.content: Show your support for him with a sympathetic quote. When he’s going through a difficult time, a sympathetic quote might be just the thing to bring him comfort . It also helps remind him he’s not alone. Share one of these supportive, sympathetic quotes to help him feel a little better about the world: “Sorrow is so easy to express and yet so hard to tell.” – Joni Mitchell “Pain is certain, suffering is optional.” – Buddha “There is no pain so great as the Memory of joy in present grief.” – Aeschylus “It is not length of life, but depth of life.” – Ralph Waldo Emerson “There is something terribly morbid in the modern sympathy with pain. One should sympathize with the color, the beauty, the joy of life. The less said about life’s sores the better.” – Oscar Wilde “I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow, but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.” – Agatha Christie “There is no greater sorrow than to recall happiness in times of misery.” – Dante Alighieri “Mostly it is loss which teaches us about the worth of things.” – Arthur Schopenhauer “When the heart grieves over what is has lost, the spirit rejoices over what it has left.” – Sufi “Truly, it is in the darkness that one finds the light, so when we are in sorrow, then this light is nearest of all to us.” – Meister Eckhart “You can’t truly heal from a loss until you allow yourself to really feel the loss.” – Mandy Hale “Although the world is full of suffering, it is also full of overcoming it.” – Helen Keller “Darkness may hide the trees and the flowers from the eyes but it cannot hide love from the soul.” – Rumi “Unable are the loved to die, for love is immortality.” – Emily Dickinson “The pain I feel now is the happiness I had before. That’s the deal.” – C.S. Lewis

steps.title: Try a short quote when you’re sending him a quick text.
steps.content: Try a short quote when you’re sending him a quick text. Sometimes the best way to reach out to a guy is with a short quote that gets right to the point. Try one of these quotes that say a whole lot in just a few words: “In case you ever foolishly forget: I am never not thinking of you.” – Virginia Woolf “In my thoughts, you are the most beautiful story ever written.” – A. A. Attanasio “I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once.” – John Green “You are my heart, my life, my one and only thought.” – Arthur Conan Doyle “There are never enough ‘I love yous.’” – Lenny Bruce “I am in you and you in me, mutual in divine love.” William Blake “Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.” – Aristotle “Who are wise in love, love most, say least.” – Alfred, Lord Tennyson “There is no remedy for love but to love more.” – Henry David Thoreau “At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet.” – Plato “If I know what love is, it is because of you.” – Hermann Hesse “The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.” – Audrey Hepburn “I am thinking of you in my sleepless solitude tonight.” – Charles Bukowski “And if ever I'm alone you'll say. I’ll be thinking about you.” – Calvin Harris “My heart dances with joy when I think about you.” – Debasish Mridha

steps.title: Brighten his day with a quote first thing in the morning.
steps.content: Brighten his day with a quote first thing in the morning. Getting an uplifting quote is a wonderful way to start the day, especially when it’s from someone who cares. Try one of these quotes to bring a little extra sunshine to his morning: “It isn't as bad as you sometimes think it is. It all works out. Don't worry. I say that to myself every morning.” – Gordon B. Hinckley “When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive, to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.” – Marcus Aurelius “Morning is an important time of day because how you spend your morning can often tell you what kind of day you are going to have.” – Lemony Snicket “I’m always thinking about creating. My future starts when I wake up every morning. Every day, I find something creative to do with my life.” – Miles Davis “Each morning, when I open my eyes, I say to myself: ‘I, not events, have the power to make me happy or unhappy today.’” – Groucho Marx “You can only come to the morning through the shadows.” – J.R.R. Tolkien “The sun is new each day.” – Heraclitus “Don’t count the days. Make the days count.” – Muhammad Ali “There is a morning inside you waiting to burst open into light.” – Rumi “The morning was full of sunlight and hope.” – Kate Chopin “Success is to wake up each morning and consciously decide that today will be the best day of your life.” – Keno Poirot “Now that your eyes are open, make the Sun jealous with your burning passion to start the day. Make the Sun jealous or stay in bed.” – Malak El Halabi “Some people dream of success, while other people get up every morning and make it happen.” – Wayne Huizenga “Every morning, I wake up saying, ‘I'm still alive, a miracle.’ And so I keep on pushing.” – Jim Carrey “First thing every morning before you arise, say out loud, 'I believe,' three times.” – Ovid

steps.title: Send your love across the miles with a sweet “thinking of you” quote.
steps.content: Send your love across the miles with a sweet “thinking of you” quote. Long-distance relationships can be tough. Communicating regularly is one of the most important parts of making a long-distance relationship work . [3] X Research source Here are some quotes to help you keep the lines of communication open: “No matter where you go, you will always be in my heart.” – Anthony T. Hincks “Love, having no geography, knows no boundaries.” – Truman Capote “Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.” – Maya Angelou “Distance means so little, when someone means so much.” – Tom McNeal “I exist in two places, here and where you are.” – Margaret Atwood “Absence is to love what wind is to fire; it extinguishes the small, it inflames the great.” – Roger de Bussy-Rabutin “And one by one the nights between our separated cities are joined to the night that unites us.” – Pablo Neruda “My dear, I think of you always and at night I build myself a warm nest of things I remember and float in your sweetness till morning.” – Zelda Fitzgerald “I think we dream so we don’t have to be apart for so long. If we’re in each other’s dreams, we can be together all the time.” – A.A. Milne “Absence sharpens love, presence strengthens it.” – Benjamin Franklin “Once trust is built, distance cannot kill it. Time and space alone cannot destroy authentic connection.” – Vironika Tugaleva “As long as we share the same sky and breathe the same air, we’re still together.” – Donna Lynn Hope “And ever has it been known that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.” – Khalil Gibran “Distance unites missing beats of two hearts in love.” – Munia Khan “True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils.” – Baltasar Gracián

steps.title: Tell your buddy you got his back with a “thinking of you” quote.
steps.content: Tell your buddy you got his back with a “thinking of you” quote. Guys aren’t always good at expressing their emotions. [4] X Research source But that doesn’t mean they want to hear from the people who care about them. Let him know you’re thinking about him with one of these quotes: “A best friend is the one who brings out the best in you.” – Henry Ford “Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.” – Euripides “Friends are the family we choose for ourselves.” – Edna Buchanan “In the cookies of life, friends are the chocolate chips.” – Salman Rushdie “Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.” – Woodrow Wilson “Friends are the family you choose.” – Jess C. Scott “A friend is someone who thinks you’re a good egg even though you’re slightly cracked.” – Bernard Meltzer “True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils.” – Baltasar Gracián “A good friend will help you move. But a best friend will help you move a dead body.” – Jim Hayes “Friends are the siblings God never gave us.” – Mencius “Friendship is born at that moment when one person says to another, ‘What! You too? I thought I was the only one.’” – C.S. Lewis “A friend is what the heart needs all the time.” – Henry Van Dyke “A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.” – Walter Winchell “A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.” – Elbert Hubbard “A true friend is the greatest of all blessings.” – François de La Rochefoucauld

steps.title: Use a “thinking of you” quote to let your brother know you care.
steps.content: Use a “thinking of you” quote to let your brother know you care. You might not always get along with your brother. That doesn’t mean you don’t love him and want to be a good brother . Stay connected by sending him a quote from your favorite childhood cartoon, or try one of these: “Half the time when brothers wrestle, it’s just an excuse to hug each other.” – James Patterson “What strange creatures brothers are!” – Jane Austen “Dear big brother, you may be part of my family, but I will always consider you a friend.” – Catherine Pulsifer “A brother is a friend given by nature.” – Ernest Legouvé “Help your brother’s boat across, and your own will reach the shore.” – Hindu Proverb “Once a brother, always a brother, no matter the distance, no matter the difference and no matter the issue.” – Byron Pulsifer “The highlight of my childhood was making my brother laugh so hard that food came out of his nose.” – Garrison Keillor “When brothers agree, no fortress is as strong as their common life.” – Antisthenes “I had a brother who was my savior, made my childhood bearable.” – Maurice Sendak “Brothers don’t necessarily have to say anything to each other—they can sit in a room and be together and just be completely comfortable with each other.” – Leonardo DiCaprio “I, who have no sisters or brothers, look with some degree of innocent envy on those who may be said to be born to friends.” – James Boswell “Brothers aren’t simply close; brothers are knit together.” – Robert Rivers “Sometimes being a brother is even better than being a superhero.” – Marc Brown “A sibling may be the keeper of one’s identity, the only person with the keys to one’s unfettered, more fundamental self.” – Marian Sandmaier “There is no love like the love for a brother. There is no love like the love from a brother.” – Astrid Alauda

steps.title: Express your love for your dad with the perfect “thinking of you” quote.
steps.content: Express your love for your dad with the perfect “thinking of you” quote. Sending a “thinking of you” quote out of the blue is a nice way to surprise your dad and make him happy . An expressive quote, like the ones below, is ideal for telling your dad how much you love and appreciate him: “Everything I do in my life, I do to make my mum and dad proud. I want to carry on in my dad’s footsteps and make sure that his legacy lives on forever.” – Bindi Irwin “When I was a kid, I said to my father one afternoon, Daddy, will you take me to the zoo? He answered, if the zoo wants you, let them come and get you.” – Jerry Lewis “My Father didn’t tell me how to live; he lived, and let me watch him do it.” – Clarence Budington Kelland “A father’s smile has been known to light up a child’s entire day.” – Susan Gale “Dads are most ordinary men turned by love into heroes, adventurers, story-tellers, and singers of song.” – Pam Brown “Any man can be a father, but it takes someone special to be a dad.” – Anne Geddes “My father gave me my dreams. Thanks to him, I could see a future.” – Liza Minnelli “No man I ever met was my father’s equal, and I never loved any other man as much.” – Hedy Lamarr “I love my father as the stars—he's a bright shining example and a happy twinkling in my heart.” – Terri Guillemets “She did not stand alone, but what stood behind her, the most potent moral force in her life, was the love of her father.” – Harper Lee “When my father didn’t have my hand… he had my back.” – Linda Poindexter “Remember: What dad really wants is a nap. Really.” – Dave Barry “To her, the name of father was another name for love.” – Fanny Fern “The older I get, the smarter my father seems to get.” – Tim Russert “My appreciation for my father’s greatness cannot be measured.” – Jennifer Williamson

steps.title: How can you choose the right “thinking of you” quote for him?
steps.content: How can you choose the right “thinking of you” quote for him? Think about his personality and interests. Does he have a favorite writer or celebrity? If so, try to find a quote from that person that fits the situation. Another option is to match the tone of the quote to your relationship and the situation. Do you joke around a lot? Send a funny quote. If they’ve recently lost a loved one, try a more sympathetic quote. It also makes sense to take your own personality into consideration. Pick a poem that fits your personality, too. For example, if you are a direct straight-shooter, pick a quote that’s more to the point over one that uses a lot of flowery language.

steps.title: How do you personalize a “thinking of you” quote?
steps.content: How do you personalize a “thinking of you” quote? The best way to personalize a quote is to pick one that will be meaningful to the person you send it to. Another option is to add a short note that puts the quote in context. Just say something like: “Hey! I saw this quote, and it made me think of you. Hope it gives you a laugh!” “I’ve been thinking about you a lot lately. When I read this quote, I thought it might help you get through all the stuff you’re going through right now.”

steps.title: What are some clever ideas for sharing a “thinking of you” quote?
steps.content: What are some clever ideas for sharing a “thinking of you” quote? Aside from a text, call, or greeting card from a store, there are a few more unique ways you can send someone a quote. Here are a few options: Include it as the message in a handmade card . Leave a note where they’ll see it as they go about their day, like on a mirror, in their lunch, or on their shoes. Record a voice text with you reciting the quote. Give them a small gift and write the quote on the gift tag.

steps.title: How do you respond when someone sends a “thinking of you” quote?
steps.content: How do you respond when someone sends a “thinking of you” quote? The easiest way to respond is with a simple “ thank you .” However, it’s also appropriate to let the person who sent you a quote know how you felt about it. Here are a few examples of responses: “Thank you so much for the quote! I laughed so hard I shot cola out of my nose.” “I wanted to let you know the quote you sent really touched me. I appreciated it so much.” Another fun option is to send them a quote in return that answers or plays off the one they sent you.
